Edward Ashton Rollins (December 8, 1828 â€“ September 7, 1885) was an American lawyer, banker, and politician who served as the 4th Commissioner of Internal Revenue from 1865 to 1869. Rollins also served as the Speaker of the New Hampshire House of Representatives from 1861 to 1862.
